alert.note: Alert for Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:44AM EST until December 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... North Nashua River At Fitchburg affecting Worcester County. For the North Nashua River...including Fitchburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Nashua River at Fitchburg. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Flooding of low lying areas along the river can be expected. Flooding encroaches on businesses near the junction of River and Depot streets in Fitchburg. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 6.7 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.7 feet on 02/04/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon. this evening at 1045 PM EST.
